Keywords: Cosmic
Real Name: Clyde Wyncham Jr.
Special Powers
TARGETING: Characters
WE WERE JUST HAVING FUN... BEFORE WE TAKE IT ALL AWAY: Each time an opposing character heals, give Marquis of Death a False Hope token. // Pulse Wave. When Marquis of Death uses it, you may remove any number of False Hope tokens. If you do, each hit character is dealt X damage instead where X is the number of tokens removed.
SHAPE REALITY TO MY OWN VISION: Energy Explosion. When Marquis of Death uses it, for each hit target you may choose that they are healed 1 click instead of being dealt damage.
YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND THE FORCES YOU TOY WITH: STOP. Invincible.
Trade Marquis of Death Want Marquis of Death

It not even stat replacement since it the character dealt damage equal to counters (so the number of clicks of damage before reducers are applied) and the Marquis Damage stat remains unchanged (modified or replaced).

The rule of three applies to modifiers. This is a replacement value. If the game went on forever and he ended up with 20 tokens, he would do 20 damage.

At first glance I would agree with you other than I have used mind control to great effect. Looking closer though, should he energy explode 6 figures and heal them all on their top clicks (2 bolts), next turn he pulse waves everyone for 6 each...
February 11, 2021
Goop
For 200 points you are primarily paying for 3 stop click and a full dial of pulse wave. That is good but honestly for 200pts i want more than one attack per turn. Only side step to move isn't that great either and you lose it mid dial for mind control which you should not be doing with your 200pt primary attacker. You will need some tk in there to move him around and somehow stay out of range of the pulse wave blast. He's also kind of a weird piece doing the whole "i'll heal you instead of damage you so i can damage you later for more". Eh... i'd just play him at 60, if that.
